    • Player

      public Player(String name, PlayerColor color, Game game)

  • Method Details

    • setShip

      public void setShip(Ship ship)
      To be only used for TESTING PURPOSES

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      the name of the player.

    • getColor

      public PlayerColor getColor()
      Returns:
      the color of the player.

    • getColorUnicode

      public String getColorUnicode()
      Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the player's color. Each color is represented by a specific Unicode value for console text formatting: - BLUE corresponds to "[34m" - GREEN corresponds to "[32m" - RED corresponds to "[31m" - Other colors (default case) correspond to "[33m".
      Returns:
      a string representing the Unicode escape sequence for the player's color.

    • getShip

      public Ship getShip()
      Returns:
      the Ship object associated with the player.

    • getPosition

      public int getPosition()
      Calculates and returns the player's position on the flight board. The position is calculated as the sum of the current cell and the number of loops completed timed by the path length
      Returns:
      the player's current position as an integer.

    • getRanking

      public Integer getRanking()
      Determines and returns the player's ranking based on their position relative to other players in the game.
      Returns:
      the player's ranking as a 1-based integer value. If the player's color is not found in the list of sorted players, returns -1.

    • move

      public void move(int delta)
      Moves the player by a specified delta. The delta value can be positive or negative, and it updates the player's current cell on the flight board.
      Parameters:
      delta - the change in position (positive for forward movement, negative for backward).

    • getLoops

      public int getLoops()
      Returns:
      the number of loops completed.

    • addLoop

      public void addLoop()
      Increments the number of loops completed by the player by one.

    • removeLoop

      public void removeLoop()
      Decrements the number of loops completed by the player by one.

    • getCurrentCell

      public int getCurrentCell()
      Returns:
      the index of the current cell the player occupies.

    • setCurrentCell

      public void setCurrentCell(int currentCell)
      Sets the player's current cell on the flight board.
      Parameters:
      currentCell - the new current cell index for the player.

    • getNumCredits

      public double getNumCredits()
      Returns:
      the number of credits currently possessed by the player

    • updateCredits

      public void updateCredits(double delta)
      Updates the player's credits by a specified delta value.
      Parameters:
      delta - the amount to modify the player's credits by (can be positive or negative).

    • getHeldTile

      public Tile getHeldTile()
      Returns:
      the Tile currently held by the player.

    • setHeldTile

      public void setHeldTile(Tile t)
      Sets the tile that the player is currently holding.
      Parameters:
      t - the new Tile to be held by the player.

    • returnTile

      public Integer returnTile()
      Returns the tile currently held by the player.

      If the player is not holding any tile, this method throws an exception. The held tile is removed after this method is called, and the method returns its ID.

      Returns:
      the ID of the tile currently held by the player.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if no tile is currently held.

    • addTileInBuffer

      public void addTileInBuffer()
      Books the tile currently held by the player, adding it to the ship's buffer.

      If the ship's tile buffer is full (contains 2 tiles), an exception is thrown. The held tile is added to the buffer and removed from the player's possession.

      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the ship's tile buffer is full.

    • placeTile

      public boolean placeTile(int x, int y)
      Attempts to place the tile currently held by the player at the specified coordinates (x, y).

      The method delegates the placement to the ship's placeTile method. If the placement is valid, the tile is removed from the player's possession and the method returns true. If the placement is invalid, the tile remains held by the player, and false is returned.

      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate where the tile should be placed.
      y - the y-coordinate where the tile should be placed.
      Returns:
      true if the tile is successfully placed; false otherwise.

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      Returns:
      the Game object associated with the player.

    • isRetired

      public boolean isRetired()
      Returns:
      true if the player is retired; false otherwise.

    • setRetired

      public void setRetired(boolean retired)
      Updates the retired status of the player.
      Parameters:
      retired - a boolean flag indicating whether the player is retired. true if the player is retired; false otherwise.

    • wasLapped

      public boolean wasLapped()
      Returns:
      true if the leader has lapped the player; false otherwise.
